completion: A guide acts as a mentor who inspires and motivates Alpha students. Their distinctive role, emphasizing support and inspiration, sets them apart from conventional educators. END

2X learning is a unique method in which students acquire knowledge at twice the pace of their peers in traditional schools. By dedicating only two hours each morning exclusively to academics, these learners are able to achieve remarkable progress and efficiency in their studies. END

A check chart is a collection of learning activities, assessments, and tasks that students must complete in order to advance to the next level or grade. This additional measure ensures that the students have successfully mastered the required skills. END

A workshop is an interactive and engaging learning experience, where students can develop a wide range of valuable life skills. Workshops often cover topics such as programming, storytelling, CrossFit, participating in TED Talks, and many more! These specially designed sessions provide students with hands-on activities, creating a dynamic learning environment that encourages growth and personal development. END

prompt: What is a Test 2 Pass time?
completion: Test 2 Pass Time is a dedicated time slot allotted for students to work on and complete tasks from the Check Chart and STAR assessments. This specific period helps ensure that students stay on track with their progress and demonstrate mastery of the required skills for advancing to higher levels or grades. END

prompt: What are Levels? Why not grades?
completion: Levels consist of multiple "grades" combined into one category. For instance, LL incorporates Kindergarten to 1st grade, Linc covers 2nd to 3rd grade, L1 encompasses 3rd to 4th grade, and L2 includes 5th to 6th grade. END
Q-Break is a dedicated 15-minute interlude, specifically designed to provide students with a much-needed pause from their tasks, allowing them to recharge and refresh their minds. END

Rockit Ship is a team of highly-driven and talented young individuals who collaborate on special projects. These exceptional kids bring their skills and creativity together, working towards common goals that showcase their innovative thinking, teamwork, and passion for learning. Their projects often inspire others and contribute positively to their community or the larger world. END

prompt: What sets Alpha apart from regular schools?
completion: At Alpha, students have the flexibility to learn at their own pace, enabling them to truly excel. For instance, a fourth-grade student could be capably advancing through sixth-grade coursework. END

Core Skills is a specialized 2-hour daily session in which students immerse themselves in diverse educational applications. They typically interact with four distinct apps, devoting 30 minutes to each, in order to cultivate a comprehensive and balanced learning experience. END

Learn 2 Learn is a dedicated session focused on acquiring life skills or participating in learning science workshops. Examples include cultivating habits, adopting a growth mindset, strivingfor continuous 1% improvement, and creating mind maps. END

Morning Launch
Writing
Core Skills
Lunch
Learn2Learn
Rocketship/Resource Rangers
Q-break
Workshops
Q-break
Test 2 pass (On Thursdays Town hall)
Closing (On Friday's emporium) END

Geek Squad Session refers to the designated time period at the start of the day when we review our work from the previous day. If you happen to spot any inaccuracies or discrepancies in the data, please submit a ticket so that the data team can resolve the issue promptly. This helps ensure that everything remains accurate and runs smoothly for all involved. END
Resource rangers is a time towards the end of the day when you find a resource for something that you have been struggling with during the day. END
Boot camp is a small version of the check chart for our newcomers, it will prepare them for the real check chart for the rest of the year. END
Emporium is a quaint shop where you can make purchases using Alpha's currency. END

Alphas are our version of money where students can earn them from 2x sessions and the max amount of alphas earnable a week is 125 alphas and you can also spend them in the emporium and many other things. You can also trade your alphas in for money. END
Town Hall is an event where students actively participate in democratic decision-making by voting on new 'laws' specific to their level. END

prompt: What are the requirements for 2x learning?
completion: To fulfill the criteria, ensure you spend 25 minutes on each app, attain a minimum of 80% accuracy, and refrain from employing any anti-patterns. END

Geek Squad is the designated session at the start of each day for reviewing the previous day's work. Should you identify any discrepancies, please submit a ticket promptly, enabling the data team to address the issue and ensure all information is accurate and operations run smoothly. END

prompt: What are Strikes, Penalties, X’s, and warnings?
completion: A Strike is a disciplinary measure used at the school. The accumulation of three Strikes results in a student being asked to leave the institution. Each Strike is equivalent to receiving three penalties, while one penalty is earned after receiving Xs. END

Morning Schedule:
8:45 am: Morning Launch
9:00 am: Writing
9:20 am: Geek Squad
9:30 am: 1st Core Skills
10:30 am: Q-break
10:45 am: 2nd Core Skills
11:30 am: Lunch
Afternoon Schedule:
12:30 pm: Learn2Learn
12:45 pm: Rocketship/Resource Rangers
1:15 pm: Q-break
1:30 pm: Workshops
2:15 pm: Q-break
2:30pm: Test 2 Pass (Thursdays: Town Hall)
3:00 pm: Closing (Fridays: Emporium) END

prompt: What are Alphas? And how do they work?
completion: Our unique on-campus currency, Alpha's, offers students opportunities to earn rewards for their achievements. Through 2x-session accomplishments, students can earn up to 125 Alpha's per week. These can be spent at the Emporium and on a variety of other enticing offerings. END

prompt: What are Strikes, Penalties, X’s, and warnings?
completion: A Strike is a disciplinary measure used at the school. The accumulation of three Strikes results in a student being asked to leave the institution. Each Strike is equivalent to receiving three penalties, while one penalty is earned after receiving Xs. Three warnings could also result in a penalty. END
